reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to agree with all the other positive reviews for this lovely hotel. We stayed one night in Room 5, the green room, at the rear of the building. The bed was comfy with high quality bedlinen and duvet and the bathroom was beautifully designed with rain shower and gorgeous glass mosaic tiles. It was very clean and the proprietor was friendly. The restaurant was booked up for the evening meal but they took our number in case of cancellations. They did ring too, for a 6pm sitting, but we thought that would be too early. If the breakfast was anything to go by this is probably the best place to eat in Aberystwyth. The breakfast bar included delicious Rachel's dairy organic yogurts, croissants and cereals, as well as ccoked breakfast such as traditional Welsh - bacon, egg, beans, black pudding, tomato (grilled with thyme), mushroom and toast. We ate out at Wasabi, a new(?) Japanese sushi and noodle place, with delicious bento boxes. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Well designed boutique hotel with lovely breakfasts

likes.disliked: — the town itself is a bit shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay; a beautifully restored sea-front house, brought up to the minute in internal decor, lighting, furniture and fittings. Everywhere seemed spotlessly clean, and the staff were all very attentive and solicitous - even decorative, too! It is difficult to get a booking in the restaurant, but the breakfasts were great - delicious fresh food, in sensible quantities. Coming out of the hotel directly onto the sea-front (why else would you go to Aberystwyth?) is a delightful experience - awe-inspiring, I guess when the weather is rough, but uplifting when the sun shines across the bay, or the sun is setting over Ireland.
reviews.title: Cool chic

likes.liked: — The quality of the ultra-modern design and its execution.
likes.disliked: — The bedroom is slightly small, and a tiny bit of maintenace was needed to the plumbing fittings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed at this lovely B&B /hotel for our mini-honeymoon. The whole place is wonderful. The rooms, the service and the food. I have nothing bad to say at all. We were in the Blue room with great views of the sea. We had dinner in the hotel twice and it was perfect. Great wine too! They made us feel very welcome and helped with any query we had. Definitely stayed at this hotel!
reviews.title: Lovely and great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a couple of nights in September, but didn't realise it was return to University weekend, so the town was choked with cars full of people offloading possessions into new accommodation. Because the hotel is right on the seafront, parking can be problematic but the owner did manage to squeeze us into their reserved parking at short notice.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, this modern, clean and friendly hotel with gorgeous breakfasts was an absolute joy to visit. We'd return again, but next time we'll make sure the place isn't full of cars!
reviews.title: Loved this place!! A+++

likes.liked: — The lovely way the rooms were redecorated.
likes.disliked: — Only that we didn't book a room with a sea view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night and used the restaurant. The room overlooking the seafront was smart and comfortable if minimalist. The restaurant brought a little of London chic to this western outpost of Wales., An imaginative menu with some good examples of local produce well cooked and immaculately presented. A mainly young,courteous,helpful and enthusiastic staff. Isabelle was warmth, charm and efficiency personified. Would definitely book again.
reviews.title: Smart yet personal hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 3 star hotel in Aberystwyth last October, and whilst not the worst hotel that we have ever stayed in, it did not offer good value for money, nor were the fixtures and fittings to reasonable standard nor was the building in any way impressive inside or out. In short it needed a huge investment in both money and imagination to be half-way passable.
reviews.title: Aberystwyth's finest, without a doubt!

likes.liked: — the first-class quality & care of absolutely everything connected to the small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The GWESTY CYMRU is the complete opposite of this description. It is fantastic! The unrivalled quality and care is easy to see in virtually everything connected to this small 8 bedroom hotel and that includes the staff. Huw and his wife have through talent and hard work built-up an amazingly successful business, and all in less than a year of trading (11 months I was told).
reviews.title: Ardderchog!

likes.liked: — The rooms were a treat in themselves
likes.disliked: — it could benefit from air conditioning in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have no hestitation whatsoever in recommending this fine hotel, indeed this is the first time that we have ever written a review of this type and the reason that we have done so is that we believe that the owners of this hotel deserve to be successful.
reviews.title: Friendly beautiful hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Michael & Christine Dand
reviews.title: Great small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Loved this hotel which is a very good boutique hotel. We found the website very good and stayed in the purple room (room 4 which has a lovely bay window where you can sit looking at the seafront). The outward appearence of the hotel does not prepare you for the quality of the interior decor which is excellent, so do not be put off by that as it is very plain and simple.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.liked: — Excellent quality of furnishings, and good food
likes.disliked: — the town itself is run down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on our anniversary whilst driving up to Snowdonia. We ate in the restaurant in the evening and the meal was excellent but if we wanted to be picky my wife had the Fillet Steak and asked for medium but it was medium to well done but still excellent all around. The breakfast menu was excellent, really good choices, Welsh Rarebit (which was wonderful), Full Welsh Breakfast, Eggs & Smoked Salmon and even a Welsh Doorstep Bacon Sandwich! The evening meal prices had been reduced from the website price which was slightly expensive but we have paid more for meals at other places and not had such good food. The staff were very helpful and all locals which was a pleasant change!
reviews.title: Fabulous Gwesty in Aber

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aberystwyth itself is obviously undergoing a make over especially along the sea front and if honest it needs it. It is a typical seaside town and ok for a few nights stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful bed!

likes.disliked: — People next door smoking out of their window, causing the smoke to come into our room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If all the refurbishments are done to the Gwesty Cymru standards this will be a good thing. Price wise at £105 it was well worth it, evening meal cost us £75 for two courses and wine (also had liquer coffees which unfortunately had no liquer in them so just give those a miss but maybe we should have complained) Also the sunsets are amazing here.
reviews.title: Simply amazing

likes.liked: — Hotel decor, friendly owners, great food, good locality to shops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again as our next evening stay cost us £150 a night and was not worth it compared to this hotel.
reviews.title: unpleasant stay

likes.disliked: — to small, no value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This lovely little hotel turned a wet couple of days into a great weekend break for the family. Our room (and bathrooms) was fab, service obliging, food really memorable (and very reasonably priced for what it is). No lift - we had to carry our own bags (no joke if you're in the room at the top, which we weren't). Our sons loved their attic room – the perfect guys' chill zone - and we had a job getting them out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Brilliant food, chic rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had saved up for months to be able to stay in a really nice hotel in Aber. When I found Gwesty Cymru I thought it looked perfect so we booked ourselves in for two nights bed and breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, spoilt by surly owner and broken shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: On arrival everything seemed very modern and inviting and the girl who showed us to out room was extremely pleasant. The room itself was extremely well done, with luxurious bathroom and a huge bed.
reviews.title: fantastic...again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a good night's sleep we had breakfast (which was very nice) and spent the day walking round the town. We came back in the late afternoon to get ready to go out that evening. My boyfriend went to have a shower while I watched TV. I was just dozing off when there was a knock on the door and when I opened it the owner was there. He told me that the water from my boyfriend's shower was coming down into the room below. When he left I opened the door to the bathroom and my boyfriend was there, trying to mop up the water which was very deep on the floor.
reviews.title: A jewel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: It turned out that the drain in the shower itself was blocked and we couldn't get any water to go down it. There was no lip on the edge of the shower so the water had just poured out. After we had mopped up the majority of the water we went and bought some paper towels to blot on the carpet outside the door, which had got wet too. We did all we could, then went out for a little while, but thinking about what had happened really had upset my boyfriend and we came home early. Neither of us slept well that night.
reviews.title: Fantastic service and food

likes.disliked: — No view from my room but they had warned me of that
